hpnicfMACInformation.name: hpnicfMACInformation

revisions.description: The initial version of this MIB file.

hpnicfMACInformation.description: This MIB file is to provide the definition of the MAC Information general configuration. MAC Information feature is used to make that the changed MAC information in the monitored device is knowable in remote monitoring device.

HpnicfMACInfoWorkMode.name: HpnicfMACInfoWorkMode
HpnicfMACInfoWorkMode.description: The working mode of the MAC Information feature.

hpnicfMACInformationEnabled.name: hpnicfMACInformationEnabled
hpnicfMACInformationEnabled.description: The value is a global setting. The feature will not work until the value is set to enabled(1). If the value is set to disabled(2), the feature will stop working even there are interfaces that have been enabled the feature.

hpnicfMACInformationcSendInterval.name: hpnicfMACInformationcSendInterval
hpnicfMACInformationcSendInterval.description: The maximum interval that the device generate syslogs or traps. The unit is second.

hpnicfMACInformationLearntMACNum.name: hpnicfMACInformationLearntMACNum
hpnicfMACInformationLearntMACNum.description: The number of MAC addresses that learnt by the device since the hpnicfMACInformationEnabled is set to enabled(1) and hpnicfMACLearntEnable is set to enabled(1) at least on one interface. If the hpnicfMACInformationEnabled is set to disabled(2), the object will always return 0.

hpnicfMACInformationRemovedMACNum.name: hpnicfMACInformationRemovedMACNum
hpnicfMACInformationRemovedMACNum.description: The number of MAC addresses that removed by the device since the hpnicfMACInformationEnabled is set to enabled(1) and hpnicfMACRemovedEnable is set to enabled(1) at least on one interface. If the hpnicfMACInformationEnabled is set to disabled(2), the object will always return 0.

hpnicfMACInformationTrapSendNum.name: hpnicfMACInformationTrapSendNum
hpnicfMACInformationTrapSendNum.description: The number of traps that have been generated. This object is valid only when the hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to trap(1). If the hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to syslog(2), the object will always return 0.

hpnicfMACInformationSyslogSendNum.name: hpnicfMACInformationSyslogSendNum
hpnicfMACInformationSyslogSendNum.description: The number of syslogs that have been generated. This object is valid only when the hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to syslog(2). If the hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to trap(1), the object will always return 0.

hpnicfMACInformationCacheLen.name: hpnicfMACInformationCacheLen
hpnicfMACInformationCacheLen.description: The maximum queue lenth used to cache the changed MAC addresses information in the monitored device. If the value is set to 0, syslog or trap will generate as soon as there is a MAC address learnt or removed.

hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode.name: hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode
hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode.description: The working mode of MAC Information feature. If the object is set to trap(1), the device will use trap mode to notify the MAC address information and all properties of trap interrelated is valid. If the object is set to syslog(2), the device will use syslog mode to notify the MAC address information and all properties of trap interrelated is invalid.

hpnicfMACInfomationIfTable.name: hpnicfMACInfomationIfTable
hpnicfMACInfomationIfTable.description: The table is used to enable or disable the MAC Information feature on interfaces.

hpnicfMACLearntEnable.name: hpnicfMACLearntEnable
hpnicfMACLearntEnable.description: If the object is set to enabled(1) on interface, the device will cache the MAC address information that learnt on the interface.

hpnicfMACRemovedEnable.name: hpnicfMACRemovedEnable
hpnicfMACRemovedEnable.description: If the object is set to enable(1) on interface, the device will cache the MAC address information that removed on the interface.

hpnicfMACInformationChangedTrap.name: hpnicfMACInformationChangedTrap
hpnicfMACInformationChangedTrap.description: When the cached number of MAC address information is reached the value specified by hpnicfMACInformationCacheLen, trap is generated and is sent to the remote monitoring device. The trap is also generated when the amount of time elapsed since the previous notification is greater than the interval value specified by hpnicfMACInformationcSendInterval and there is at least one cached MAC address information learnt or removed. The object is valid only when hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to trap(1). When the hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to syslog(2), No trap will be generated even hpnicfMACInformationEnabled is set to enabled(1) and the feature is enabled on interface.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapIndex.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapIndex
hpnicfMACInfoTrapIndex.description: The sequence number of trap information. When it reaches the maximum value, it should be set to 1.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapCount.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapCount
hpnicfMACInfoTrapCount.description: The cell number of the current trap information. The trap message may consists of more than one MAC address information. Each of the one MAC address information in one trap is called cell.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsg.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsg
hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsg.description: This object is the MAC information that learnt or removed in the monitored device. It can consists of more than one MAC information in the object. This object is in the format of '<cell1><cell2>...'. Each cell consists of 12 octets in the format of '<operationType><VLAN><MAC><MACtype><ifIndex>'. <operationType> is the reason type of MAC address changed and have size of 1 octet. It only supports the following values. 1 - MAC learnt. 2 - MAC removed. <VLAN> is the vlan number that correspond to the MAC address in MAC address table and has size of 2 octet. <MAC> is the MAC address and has size of 6 octets. <MACtype> is the MAC address type and has size of 1 octet. It only supports the following values. 0 - Unknown 1 - Learnt 2 - Config dynamic 3 - Config static 4 - Blackhole 5 - Security 6 - 802.1x 7 - MAC authentication 8 - Voice VLAN 9 - Reserved <ifIndex> is the index of the interface where the MAC address is learnt or removed and has size of 2 octets.

hpnicfMACInformationChangedTrapExt.name: hpnicfMACInformationChangedTrapExt
hpnicfMACInformationChangedTrapExt.description: When the cached number of MAC address information is reached the value specified by hpnicfMACInformationCacheLen, trap is generated and is sent to the remote monitoring device. The trap is also generated when the amount of time elapsed since the previous notification is greater than the interval value specified by hpnicfMACInformationcSendInterval and there is at least one cached MAC address information learnt or removed. The object is valid only when hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to trap(1). When the hpnicfMACInfomationWorkMode is set to syslog(2), No trap will be generated even hpnicfMACInformationEnabled is set to enabled(1) and the feature is enabled on interface.

hpnicfMACInformationMovedTrap.name: hpnicfMACInformationMovedTrap
hpnicfMACInformationMovedTrap.description: When the MAC address has been moved to another interface, trap is generated and is sent to the remote monitoring device.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapIndexExt.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapIndexExt
hpnicfMACInfoTrapIndexExt.description: The sequence number of trap information. When it reaches the maximum value, it should be set to 1.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapCountExt.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapCountExt
hpnicfMACInfoTrapCountExt.description: The cell number of the current trap information. The trap message may consists of more than one MAC address information. Each of the one MAC address information in one trap is called cell.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgExt.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgExt
hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgExt.description: This object is the MAC information that learnt or removed in the monitored device. It can consists of more than one MAC information in the object. This object is in the format of '<cell1><cell2>...'. Each cell consists of 14 octets in the format of '<operationType><VLAN><MAC><MACtype><ifIndex>'. <operationType> is the reason type of MAC address changed and have size of 1 octet. It only supports the following values. 1 - MAC learnt. 2 - MAC removed. <VLAN> is the vlan number that correspond to the MAC address in MAC address table and has size of 2 octet. <MAC> is the MAC address and has size of 6 octets. <MACtype> is the MAC address type and has size of 1 octet. It only supports the following values. 0 - Unknown 1 - Learnt 2 - Config dynamic 3 - Config static 4 - Blackhole 5 - Security 6 - 802.1x 7 - MAC authentication 8 - Voice VLAN 9 - Reserved <ifIndex> is the index of the interface where the MAC address is learnt or removed and has size of 4 octets.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedAddress.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedAddress
hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedAddress.description: The MAC address that is moved between interfaces.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedVlan.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedVlan
hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedVlan.description: The VLAN number in which the MAC address is moved.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedFromIf.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedFromIf
hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedFromIf.description: The index of the interface from which the MAC address is moved.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedToIf.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedToIf
hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedToIf.description: The index of the interface to which the MAC address is moved.

hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedCount.name: hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedCount
hpnicfMACInfoTrapMsgMovedCount.description: The times for which the MAC address has been moved between the interfaces.
